summary: This is an internal FBI email from June 25, 2019, discussing preparations for Jeffrey Epstein's upcoming arrest by the SDNY. It outlines procedures for compiling victim information from the Victim Notification System (VNS) to ensure victims are notified of their rights promptly after the arrest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the upcoming arrest and investigation by SDNY; the case involves his victims.

events.title: FBI coordination for Epstein arrest
events.description: FBI personnel discuss preparations for an upcoming arrest of Jeffrey Epstein, including plans for SDNY to issue a press release and set up an 800 number for victims to self-identify.

events.title: Expected return of FBI personnel
events.description: The email author notes they will be out of the office until July 3, 2019, and requests victim data exports until that date.

keyFacts: An arrest of Jeffrey Epstein was imminent as of June 25, 2019, with SDNY leading the operation.
The FBI was preparing to compile victim information from the Victim Notification System (VNS) to notify victims of their rights post-arrest.
Specific procedures were outlined for indexing victims, including requiring full names, addresses, and complete guardian information for minors.
The email emphasizes the high-profile nature of the case and the need for compliance with federal victim notification laws.
Multiple FBI personnel are referenced in the email, but their names are redacted in the provided text.
